``` {.python .cell-code}
import numpy as np
from empiricaldist import Pmf
from scipy.stats import binom

k, n = 140, 250
like_fair = binom.pmf(k, n, 0.5)
```
:::


::: {#7113f188 .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
ramp_up = np.arange(50)
ramp_down = np.arange(50, -1, -1)
a = np.append(ramp_up, ramp_down)

xs = np.linspace(0, 1, 101)
triangle = Pmf(a, xs)
triangle.normalize()
biased_triangle = triangle.copy()
biased_triangle[0.5] = 0
biased_triangle.normalize()

likelihood = binom.pmf(k, n, xs)
like_triangle = np.sum(biased_triangle * likelihood)
```
:::


::: {#54e820f7 .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
k = like_fair / like_triangle
k, k / (k + 1)
```
